text: As addressed by Stephen Yang in his ICCE 2019 keynote speech (Yang, 2019), precisioneducation is a new challenge when applying artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning, and learning analyticsto improve teaching quality and learning performance. The goal of precision education is to identify at-riskstudents as early as possible and provide timely intervention on the basis of teaching and learning experiences(Lu et al., 2018). Drawing from this main theme of precision education, this special issue advocates an in-depthdialogue between cold technology and warm humanity, in turn offering greater understanding of precisioneducation. For this special issue, thirteen research papers that specialize in precision education, AI, machinelearning, and learning analytics to engage in an in-depth research experiences concerning various applications, methods, pedagogical models, and environments were exchanged to achieve better understanding of theapplication of AI in education
